items.htmlSnippet:
Feb 25, 2013 ... Ben Affleck does it again. His 'Argo' - a film about a fake movie - wins best picture
at the Academy Awards. Ang Lee takes best director for 'Life ...

imageobject.caption: Jack Nicholson with 'Argo' director Ben Affleck after 'Argo' won best picture. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Daniel Day-Lewis wins the Oscar for best actor for his role in 'Lincoln.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Quentin Tarantino wins the Oscar for original screenplay for 'Django Unchained.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jennifer Lawrence tumbles on the steps as she makes her way to the stage after winning the Oscar for best actress for 'Silver Linings Playbook.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Ang Lee wins the Oscar for best director for 'Life Of Pi.' (Photo: Robert Hanashiro, USA TODAY)
Michael Douglas and Jane Fonda. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Adele and Paul Epworth win an Oscar for original song for 'Skyfall.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Charlize Theron and Duston Hoffman walk onstage to present the Oscar for adapted screenplay. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Anne Hathaway wins the Oscar for best supporting actress for her role in 'Les Miserables.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
George Clooney introduces a segment called "In Memoriam, to honor those in the industry who have passed away." (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Salma Hayek on stage. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Norah Jones sings 'Everybody Needs a Best Friend' from 'Ted.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Presenters for best original score: Richard Gere, Renee Zellweger, Queen Latifah and Catherine Zeta-Jones. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Barbra Streisand performs onstage during the Oscars. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Production designer Rick Carter accepts the best production design award for 'Lincoln.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Adele sings the theme from 'Skyfall.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Sandra Bullock presents the Oscar for film editing to William Goldenberg for 'Argo.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Anne Hathaway gets a hug from co-star Hugh Jackman after winning the Oscar for best supporting actress for her work in 'Les Miserables.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Christopher Plummer walks onstage to present the Oscar for best supporting actress. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Paul N.J. Ottosson wins the Oscar for achievement in sound editing for 'Zero Dark Thirty,' which tied for the award with 'Skyfall.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Adele sings the theme from Skyfall. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
The cast of 'Les Miserables' performs at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Anne Hathaway receives a kiss as she went back to her seat after a performance by the cast of 'Les Miserables.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jennifer Hudson performs 'And I Am Telling You I'm Not Going' from 'Dreamgirls' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Catherine Zeta-Jones, center, performs the musical number 'All That Jazz' from 'Chicago.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jennifer Hudson performs 'And I Am Telling You I'm Not Going' from 'Dreamgirls.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jessica Chastain and Jennifer Garner present the Oscar for best foreign language film to 'Amour.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jessica Chastain and Jennifer Garner walk onstage to present the Oscar for best foreign language film. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jennifer Aniston and Channing Tatum hit the stage. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Richard Gere and Halle Berry share a moment. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Shirley Bassey wows the crowd with a rendition of 'Goldfinger' during a musical salute to James Bond films. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Charlize Theron dances with Channing Tatum during the Academy Awards show. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Claudio Miranda wins the Oscar for achievement in cinematography for 'Life Of Pi.' (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Presenters for the Oscar for achievement in cinematography line up. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Brenda Chapman and Mark Andrews win the Oscar for best animated feature film. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Melissa McCarthy and Paul Rudd were presenters for best animated short film. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Reese Witherspoon walks to the stage. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Octavia Spencer is the presenter for the best supporting actor. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Christoph Waltz wins the Oscar for best supporting actor. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Jack Nicholson in the audience. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Christoph Waltz wins the Oscar for best supporting actor. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Octavia Spencer is the presenter for the best supporting actor. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Joseph Gordon-Levitt, host Seth MacFarlane and Daniel Radcliffe in an opening number at the Oscars. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Charlize Theron dances with Channing Tatum. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Host Seth MacFarlane. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Seth MacFarlane on the big screen during the Academy Awards show. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
Host Seth MacFarlane gets to work on Sunday during the Academy Awards show at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood. (Photo: Robert Deutsch, USA TODAY)
